bnf_parser

Interface SubparserInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BnfParser.Subparser

    public interface SubparserInterface
    Simple interface used between BnfParser and classes extending Callable. It is used to diminish coupling between packets/classes.
    Author:
    Hubert Lemelin

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Collector evaluateRule(Rule rule)
      Tries to match the specified rule.
      java.lang.String matchPattern(java.lang.String pattern)
      The class implements this interface must provide this method.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluateRule

        Collector evaluateRule(Rule rule)
                throws ParsingFailedException,
                       CallableContainsMoreThanOneCollectorException,
                       NoFileSpecifiedException
        Tries to match the specified rule.
        Parameters:
        rule - The rule to be evaluated.
        Returns:
        Return an instance of the collector specified in the rule. It can be null so one must always check if it is null before calling any methods on it.
        Throws:
        ParsingFailedException - Thrown when the rule did not match.
        CallableContainsMoreThanOneCollectorException - Thrown when a callable contains more than one collector.
        NoFileSpecifiedException - Thrown when the parsing happens before any file was specified.

      • matchPattern

        java.lang.String matchPattern(java.lang.String pattern)
        The class implements this interface must provide this method. A pattern is the basic element used by the parser when reading a file to be parser.
        Parameters:
        pattern - The pattern to be matched
        Returns:
        The string that was matched by the pattern.
